content: represents a subset of CP commands that the system permits the user to enter. Each privilege class, sometimes called CP privilege class, is defined around a particular job or set of tasks, which creates an area outside of which the user cannot go. It is common for a user to be assigned to more than one CP privilege class. Users cannot enter commands in privilege classes to which they are not assigned. 0347 PEEK A0 V 80 Trunc=80 Size=16 Line=0 Col=1 Alt=0 File IBMDFLT DIRECT from DIRMAINT at ENDVM363 Format is NETDATA. * * * Top of File * * * PROFILE IBMDFLT ...
